intro: Agathophora algeriensis, commonly known as the Algerian agathophora, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Agathophora algeriensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
